Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> BTCH wasnt mined, it was airdropped, so there is no massive miner investment that needs to be protected. By making it a 50% PoS/50% PoW it is true that over time, the current holders will get diluted by 50%, but over a long time. So if there is a very reasonable expectation of a price doubling, it is making sense even for current stakeholders. BTCH is a unique situation and the situation of other coins shouldnt be applied to BTCH

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Here is something to think about relevant to BTCH supply: We airdropped about 16M BTC into the BTCH chain, but there have been many studies about how most likely, about ~4M BTC is lost forever, on broken harddrives or owned by dead people or whatever. That 4M BTCH that corresponds with it is "dead", it will never be bought/sold/mined, and that means that current BTCH supply is actually less than 21M, if you think about coins that can be bought+sold. SO, *if* BTCH supply doubles to 42M (seems likely, but written in blood yet), the accessible supply will be 42 - 4 = 38M, which is good for current BTCH hodlers, because it means that they will not be diluted by a full 2X.

Author: Gateway#3763

Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> with active miners, we will always have people buying + selling BTCH

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so having miners is a catalyst. Miners want to sell some coins to pay for electricity or take profits, and then traders/investors buy it from them
